description: FDO Profile for Machine Annotation Services

fdoProfile.description: PID to a machine readable description of the attributes in the FDO record

fdoRecordLicense.description: The licence for the FDO record, required to be always public domain

digitalObjectType.description: PID to a description of the Type of digital object that defines the metadata, bit sequences (if any) and operations for the object

digitalObjectName.description: Name of the object type for humans

pid.description: The PID of which the FDO record is part, in DiSSCo this is a Handle or DOI. It is recommended to store this pid also in the local collection management system for the specimen.

pidIssuer.description: In case of a DOI this is a PID for the DOI Registration Agency

pidIssuerName.description: Human-readable name of the PID issuer

issuedForAgent.description: In the case of a digital specimen, this is a PID for DiSSCo as the agent responsible for serving the digital specimen object

pidRecordIssueDate.description: Date the PID record was created

pidRecordIssueNumber.description: Starts with 1 and is incrementally increased by 1 every time the pid record is updated. Compatible with DOI schema requirements.

structuralType.description: Nature of the digital object, compatible with DOI schema requirements. The nature of a digital specimen object is always "digital". Other digital objects (outside DiSSCo) could be of physical, performance or abstraction nature.

pidStatus.description: A PID is considered to have a lifecycle, PID status indicates the status in the life cycle, e.g. draft, active, retired. PID statuses are described further in the PID infrastructure design.

10320/loc.description: XML document describing location(s) of the resource
